sub_title: Strategy | Digital | Communications - I simplify complexity and turn it into a competitive advantage
summary: An agile learner and self-starter with more than a decade of success spanning technical domains, management, and leadership. My global perspective, honed across science, health, technology, and business, fuels a unique blend of strategic vision and detail-oriented precision. I thrive on untangling complexity, catalyzing change, transforming data into business impact, and bringing ideas to life at scale.

awards.title: TR35 Singapore (MIT Technology Review - Innovators under 35)
awards.description: TR35 Singapore is the list of the top innovators under the age of 35 from Southeast Asia, Australia and New Zealand. It is the regional version of MIT Technology Review's global list of 35 Innovators under 35. Identified as a Top 10 Innovator under 35 in the region, selected from hundreds of nominations

profile_positions.description:
•	Led the strategic planning, execution, and launch of the ground-breaking Danone Nutricia Campus, an educational ecosystem that transformed healthcare professional communication. Orchestrated strategic organization, platform development, governance establishment, and technology architecture.
•	Managed the comprehensive rebranding, UX redesign, and technology upgrade for Danone Nutricia Campus, culminating in the successful launch of a tailored digital education platform for healthcare professionals.
•	Established program teams, established a new legal entity, designed governance structures, and strategically positioned the initiative across diverse channels within the ecosystem.
•	Devised and executed global strategic communications plans, including tailored message houses for local adaptation, ensuring unified messaging and branding across international markets.
•	Crafted interconnected narratives that seamlessly bridged physical, traditional media, and digital assets, delivering immersive brand experiences at major congresses and tradeshows.
•	Implemented data-driven communications strategies to identify and amplify successful messaging and channels, optimizing engagement and impact.
•	Applied agile and waterfall methodologies strategically to drive ongoing product innovation, aligning with user needs, senior stakeholder vision, and overarching corporate strategy
profile_positions.title: Product Lead (Danone Nutricia Campus)

profile_positions.description:
•	Successfully redefined healthcare professional education and engagement through the seamless integration of modern digital technologies.
•	Acted as a trusted consultant specializing in healthy aging and digital innovations, with a focus on delivering crucial medical and scientific insights within the specialized nutrition sector in China.
•	Formulated strategic recommendations for initiatives in health technology, mobile applications, and the consumer space, including ground-breaking projects like an AI-based stool decoder designed to boost gut dysbiosis screening rates.
•	Spearheaded a digital transformation in the medical sector by developing a strategic playbook for virtual advisory boards and webinars, effectively navigating the challenges posed by the global pandemic
profile_positions.title: Senior Medical & Scientific Intelligence Mgr (Global)

profile_positions.description:
•	Effectively translated insightful observations into impactful business strategies, ensuring competitiveness in the dynamic landscape of personalized nutrition, gut health, and digital innovations.
•	Provided strategic guidance on harnessing competitor and market insights to inform research and business unit strategies, fostering a culture of adaptability and innovation.
•	Conducted comprehensive analysis of the competitive landscape, scientific data, and market entry opportunities, while vigilantly monitoring global macro-trends encompassing economics, geopolitics, medical advancements, and evolving consumer behaviours.
•	Collaborated with key stakeholders to redefine digital touchpoints and identify emerging technologies that would enhance the business and innovation portfolio
profile_positions.title: Senior Competitive Science & Insights Mgr

company.name: Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE)

profile_positions.company: Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE)
profile_positions.description:
•	Established a pioneering department dedicated to cultivating expertise in emerging technology realms, including structural 3D printing, advanced alloy and ceramic formulations, and next-generation structural analysis.
•	Provided mentorship, guidance, and motivation to a 32-member team, successfully mentoring two new program managers and enabling them to spearhead innovative initiatives.
•	Forged strategic partnerships with prestigious entities such as Rolls-Royce, SP's Applied Materials Engineering Centre, and the Singapore Institute of Technology within an impressive two-month timeframe.
•	Implemented a "fail fast, learn fast" project methodology across eight research endeavours in novel areas, resulting in the generation of seven new technology disclosures within a span of 10 months.
•	Presented strategic proposals to Rolls-Royce and the Advanced Remanufacturing Technology Centre, culminating in a key role in the $60 million Smart Manufacturing Joint Lab Program.
•	Led materials development efforts in alignment with national economic interests, strategically targeting infrastructure, forging partnerships, and bolstering research capabilities, ultimately facilitating multimillion-dollar projects and lucrative deals
profile_positions.title: Department Head (Structural Materials/Metallic Materials)

profile_positions.company: Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE)
profile_positions.description:
•	Spearheaded the development of institute-wide procedures for pivotal R&D operations, playing an instrumental role as part of a specially chosen transition team during a comprehensive institute reorganization.
•	Formulated a strategic framework for technology road-mapping, seamlessly implementing it across various departments to enhance long-term planning and innovation.
•	Streamlined and improved processes for the evaluation of research proposals, resulting in a remarkable 40% reduction in turnaround time, optimizing resource allocation and research project efficiency
profile_positions.title: Strategic Initiatives Lead, Strategic Planning Office

profile_positions.company: Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE)
profile_positions.description:
•	Acted upon untapped growth opportunities while connecting with industry and research partners as well as conducting analysis of past industry collaborations.
•	Tracked industry trends by attending tradeshows and conferences, creating a pipeline of more than 35 qualified leads with global strategic partners within seven months.
•	Analysed historical project metrics to identify industry collaborations with best ROI, providing visualisation into key strategic areas, ultimately growing industry revenue by 10%
profile_positions.title: Assistant Head (Technology Development), Director's Office

profile_positions.company: Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE)
profile_positions.description:
•	Spearheaded the comprehensive organization and promotion of the annual conference, resulting in a remarkable 50% increase in participant attendance compared to the previous year, and an impressive more than tripling of revenue generation.
•	Efficiently managed all aspects of the three-day conference, orchestrating six parallel sessions to accommodate over 500 anticipated attendees, as well as collaborating with over 30 session chairs.
•	Innovatively aligned the scientific program with unique special programs, emphasizing the value of public-private partnerships in R&D. These initiatives included the A*STAR-RIKEN Symposium, Asia Nano Forum 2015 Summit, an Open-Innovation session featuring industry presentations and a CTO forum, a poster session showcasing over 100 research posters, and an Industry Fair highlighting synergistic collaborations with industry partners.
•	Devised an impactful publicity plan, leveraging local networks and internet channels to boost engagement and successfully established strategic partnerships and mechanisms for event cost recovery.
profile_positions.title: Organising Chair, 5th Molecular Materials Meeting @ Singapore

profile_positions.company: Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE)
profile_positions.description:
•	Formulated innovative policies for enterprise management, with a specific focus on asset management, business continuity, and enterprise risk management at the institute level.
•	Skillfully managed a multifaceted team of 30 scientists and technical support personnel, overseeing corporate affairs, departmental budgeting, and strategic resource allocation.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Head, Patterning & Fabrication

profile_positions.company: Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE)
profile_positions.description:
•	Pioneered the development of a groundbreaking library of plasmonic color pixels through advanced data correlation techniques, integrating patterned features with optical signatures.
•	Achieved a global milestone by successfully demonstrating the world's first and smallest color print using plasmonic color pixels, garnering extensive media coverage on prominent news sites like Gizmodo, Reuters, and CNET.
•	Recognized as one of APAC's Top 10 Innovators Under 35 by EmTech Singapore, a prestigious honor awarded from among hundreds of nominations.
profile_positions.title: Materials Research Scientist

profile_positions.description: Worked in Prof. Jackie Ying’s lab. Investigated the cellular interactions and internationalization of quantum dots surface-functionalized with different moieities.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: Lessons for children from low-income families in a self-organized learning environment.
